column4: Are there such things as apt-get mirrors for Ubuntu like there are for Mandrake and their urpmi installer ?
yes
wiki.ubuntulinux.org
Is there a site similar to the Easy Urpmi site ?
wiki.ubuntulinux.org
There are NO must have scripts for Xchat
Trust me on that, you just want the tcl, perl, python and ruby plugins and nothing more.  Let users deal with their own scripts
yes there are like ignore
There is an ignore option already by default in Xchat
If you right click on a nick, it's there by default.  It's part of the nick menu
no just in must build including the default your default goval scripts are kept in /usr/share/doc/xchat-common/scripts-perl
Settings---Advanced---Userlist Popups  That is where your ignore option is kept by default and edited or removed if you want
Not every distro is like that though
ignore is a plug that come with xchat by defult it made by the devel team but its not built into binary form and is a perl script that is easly updatable/upgradable/editble
xchat-text is built into xchat
Xhat doesn't use xchat-text's source.  zed is the maintainer of xchat and the guy who used to maintain xchat-text doesn't do it anymore.  They are two seperate things now
and nov 9th.1 is the relest of debian-firefox and 9th.2 is firefox-ubuntu
NOW
Right, it used to be, but not anymore.  Xchat-text is useless
It's been 17 months since last code was put into xchat-text
ok so no xchat-text
xchat-text was updated in version 2.4 the change the version number that about it
